page.title: 05Local History Old Iron Works
page.content: At Cwmddyche an iron blast furnace was built by Messrs Ingman and Givers in 1791.Mr Alexander Raby took over about 1796.The coal was brought first from Penyfinglawdd in carts,drawn by mules but after the opening of the Caer Elms and Caerbad collieries,the transport of coal improved.Some of the iron ore was brought in ships from Lancashire and carried by rail to the furnace,but most was obtained from the Gwendraeth Valley transported in coarse sacks on the backs of mules.The Napoleonic wars stimulated the activities of his works because "so prompt are the measures of the Government at this time that four furnaces are at work night and day at Llanelly,solely confined to the Board of Ordnance." Remains of the Old Iron Works can still be seen in the village of Furnace,named after the industry.
